page.title: 14Mayfield Trout Farm
page.content: This farm is a family run business incorporating a 65 acre dairy farm as well as the trout farm. It is situated on the River Dove. The young trout are bought in as fingerlings at 3-4 inches long and can take up to 9 months before they are ready to sell. They are grouped according to size in earth ponds in the river. They are fed on vitamin enriched food pellets and their intake varies according to the water temperature. Great care is taken not to lose fish if the river suddenly rises or the ponds and filters become blocked with debris. The fish are killed to order by hand with a wooden mallet. The most popular size fish being 8-12 oz. They are all sold fresh or smoked and frozen. Trout farming has only become popular within the last five years.
